Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This papyrus "codex", which was found at Oxyrhynchus (P.Oxy. XV 1818) and which dates from the 5th-6th century, accounts for four of the five original pages. They contain Book XXII and XXIII of the "Iliad". This part of the Homerian epic deals with the combat of Achilles and Hector and the obsequies of Patrocles.
